text: Charles D’Aguilar Lawrence (27 November 1847 - 14 April 1935) was Archdeacon of Suffolk from 1901Ecclesiastical Intelligence The Times (London, England), Monday, Jan 07, 1901; pg. 8; Issue 36345 to 1917.Church Appointments The Times (London, England), Thursday, Feb 01, 1917; pg. 3; Issue 41391 The second son of the Rev. C. W. Lawrence, sometime incumbent of St Luke, Liverpool, he was educated at Eton and Christ Church, Oxford. Ordained in 1874,his first posts were curacies at Redenhall then Paddington.Crockford's Clerical Directory 1898: London, Horace Cox, 1898 He was Rector of Bermondsey from 1879 to 1889;Church web site and then of Lowestoft from 1889 to 1901. He was Rural Dean of Lothingland from 1892 to 1901; and then of Wilford from 1901 toKellys 1896 1911.‘LAWRENCE, Ven. Charles D’Aguilar’, Who Was Who, A & C Black, an imprint of Bloomsbury Publishing plc, 1920–2016; online edn, Oxford University Press, 2014 ; online edn, April 2014 accessed 16 Jan 2017 ==References== Category:1847 births Category:1935 deaths Category:People educated at Eton College Category:Alumni of Christ Church, Oxford Category:Archdeacons of Suffolk
title: Charles Lawrence (priest)
